title: Blue note Cover Sans serif
content:
Hello Tyophiles.

I have tried (and failed) to identify the two sans serifs on this Bluenote cover

the typeface used for the artists names seems similar to Trade or Franklin gothic – but the "G" is clearly different

I can't find any match for the the fat bold type..

Many thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327im_/http:/typophile.com/files/JohnPatton_LetEmRoll_6551.jpg)

Font: 

 monotype grotesque / Knockout 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: L.

comments.content:
For the artists names, I'm probably wrong and even if it sounds weird, I see Arial, distorted a bit. For title, I'd have said something close/like Alternate Gothic but many details are off and mainly /J over curved terminal. Best one I could get is [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/overview) (from No. 66 to 68) using the alternate /R (as seen [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/characters/knockoutno-68fullfeatherweight)). Still searching.

EDIT: Seeing now Kevin took the same track with Knockout so probably not so bad. But nothing about Arial...

Alternate Gothic is a good modern revival of this style.

Closest matches I can come up with are:

[http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Vonness/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Vonness/ "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Vonness/") [you'd have to edit the angled terminals]  
 [https://commercialtype.com/typefaces/giorgio/sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/https:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/giorgio/sans "https://commercialtype.com/typefaces/giorgio/sans") [Heavy; edit the spur on the G]  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/styles/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/styles/ "http://www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/styles/") [68 Full Featherweight; edit the R]

If it weren't for the R, I'd say the artists' names were set in Univers:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/univers/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/univers/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/univers/")

But it is more likely that it is Monotype Grotesque:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/")

Aktiv Grotesk is also an option:  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/dalton\_maag/aktiv\_grotesk\_corpor...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317183327/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/dalton_maag/aktiv_grotesk_corporate_regular_ot/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/dalton\_maag/aktiv\_grotesk\_corporate\_regular\_ot/")
Ryuk, I wasn't aware that Knockout had an alternate R. Thanks for the info....

Amazing!

I will go with monotype grotesque and knockout 68

Many thanks Ryuk and kthomps5 !
